mcqs.question: How are HTML comments written?
mcqs.explanation: HTML comments are written as `<!-- comment -->` and are not displayed in the browser.

mcqs.question: Where can HTML comments be placed?
mcqs.explanation: HTML comments can be placed anywhere in the HTML document.

mcqs.question: What is the main purpose of HTML comments?
options: To add code explanations for developers
mcqs.explanation: HTML comments are used to add notes or explanations for developers.

mcqs.question: Will content inside `<!-- comment -->` be rendered in the browser?
mcqs.explanation: Content inside comments is not rendered by browsers.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid HTML comment?
mcqs.explanation: `<!--- Incorrect comment --->` is not valid as the number of dashes is wrong.

mcqs.question: Can HTML comments be used to temporarily disable code?
options: Yes, they can comment out code blocks
No, comments can only be used for text
mcqs.explanation: You can use HTML comments to temporarily disable or 'comment out' parts of your HTML.

mcqs.question: What happens if you nest HTML comments?
options: The inner comment will be ignored
mcqs.explanation: HTML does not support nested comments; doing so may lead to unexpected results.

mcqs.question: Is the following a valid HTML comment? ``
mcqs.explanation: Yes, you can comment out HTML elements like this.

mcqs.question: Can you use HTML comments for hiding scripts from old browsers?
mcqs.explanation: HTML comments were once used to hide scripts from browsers that did not support JavaScript.

mcqs.question: Which will display a comment in your HTML source code?
mcqs.explanation: Only the `<!-- ... -->` format is correct for HTML comments.

mcqs.question: Can HTML comments contain other HTML tags?
options: Yes, but they will not be rendered
No, it will cause an error
mcqs.explanation: HTML comments can contain tags, but those tags will be ignored and not rendered.

mcqs.question: Which shortcut usually adds a comment in many code editors?
mcqs.explanation: Most editors use `Ctrl + /` to toggle comments.

mcqs.question: Can you place comments between attributes of an HTML tag?
options: No, it will break the tag
Only if the attribute is data-*
mcqs.explanation: Comments inside a tag's attribute list will break the tag.

mcqs.question: Will the comment `<!--- comment --->` work as expected?
options: No, it has too many dashes
mcqs.explanation: HTML comments must begin with exactly `<!--` and end with exactly `-->`.

mcqs.question: Is `<!-->` a valid HTML comment?
mcqs.explanation: `<!-->` is not a valid comment, it must end with `-->`.

mcqs.question: Are comments visible to users in the browser?
mcqs.explanation: HTML comments are not visible to users, except in the page source or developer tools.

mcqs.question: Can comments be used to store code documentation in HTML?
options: No, they are only for hiding code
mcqs.explanation: HTML comments are often used for code documentation and notes.

mcqs.question: Is there a limit to the length of an HTML comment?
options: No, there is no practical limit
mcqs.explanation: HTML comments can be of any reasonable length.

mcqs.question: Which is the correct way to comment out a block of HTML code?
mcqs.explanation: Wrap the code in `<!-- ... -->` to comment it out.

mcqs.question: What is the main benefit of using comments in HTML?
options: They help organize code and add explanations
They are visible to all users
mcqs.explanation: Comments help developers understand and organize the code.
